intro: Lisianthius anomalus, commonly known as the strange lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive shape that sets it apart from other members of the genus. Due to its limited distribution and unique features, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
